decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board with a mix of powerful creatures like Noxious Gearhulk, Grim Flayer, and Ishkanah, Grafwidow, while also utilizing cards like Grasp of Darkness and Ruinous Path to remove threats. The deck also includes a good amount of card draw and graveyard recursion with Pilgrim's Eye, Liliana, the Last Hope, and Grapple with the Past. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a powerful finisher and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet provides additional value and disruption to the opponent's strategy.

The focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with low-cost creatures and pump spells, supported by removal and protection cards. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Smuggler's Copter and Verdurous Gearhulk, while using powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn to maintain control of the battlefield. Always Watching enhances the effectiveness of the aggro strategy, while cards like Declaration in Stone and Stasis Snare provide removal options when needed. The deck aims to apply continuous pressure and outpace the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that interact with your opponent's board and hand, while also having a strong creature presence to apply pressure. The deck focuses on using cards like Grim Flayer and Ishkanah, Grafwidow to generate value and control the board, while also utilizing powerful removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Ruinous Path. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Vessel of Nascency and Grapple with the Past to help find key pieces like Emrakul, the Promised End and Noxious Gearhulk to finish off the game.

The focal point of this Azorius Aggro deck is to maximize the value of enter-the-battlefield triggers by utilizing cards like Cloudblazer and Reflector Mage in combination with Panharmonicon. This allows for multiple triggers and card advantage, while also providing disruption through bounce effects. Eldrazi Displacer and Thought-Knot Seer add additional control elements to the deck. Smuggler's Copter and Thraben Inspector provide early aggression and card filtering, allowing the deck to maintain pressure while setting up its synergies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and value-based interactions.

The deck focuses on using powerful creatures and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes cards like Grim Flayer and Mindwrack Demon to pressure the opponent while also providing card advantage. Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Emrakul, the Promised End serve as win conditions and powerful threats. Liliana, the Last Hope and Grasp of Darkness help maintain board control, while Traverse the Ulvenwald provides additional versatility and card selection. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition and overwhelming board presence.

The main focus of this Golgari Control deck is to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy through removal spells and graveyard recursion. By utilizing cards like Liliana, the Last Hope and Ishkanah, Grafwidow, the deck can grind out value and outlast the opponent's threats. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Grasp of Darkness and Grapple with the Past, ensuring that it can answer threats and maintain resources throughout the game. Ultimately, the goal is to stabilize the board and overpower the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Emrakul, the Promised End.

The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger, Toolcraft Exemplar, and Veteran Motorist. By combining aggressive creatures with powerful removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Harnessed Lightning, the deck aims to maintain tempo advantage and pressure the opponent. Support cards like Smuggler's Copter and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional value and versatility to the deck. Thalia, Heretic Cathar disrupts the opponent's game plan, while Depala, Pilot Exemplar buffs the team and helps with card advantage.

The main objective of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells in order to quickly deal damage and win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. By utilizing creatures like Hanweir Garrison, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Pia Nalaar, along with removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Harnessed Lightning, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and control the board to secure a swift victory. Additionally, cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional support and a strong finisher for the deck.

The deck focuses on using powerful aggro cards from the Azorius color combination to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Reflector Mage, Spell Queller, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar help control the board and apply pressure. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Stasis Snare and Declaration in Stone to deal with threats. The inclusion of cards like Toolcraft Exemplar and Smuggler's Copter allows for quick damage output and card advantage. The deck aims to establish board control early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures and using cards like Always Watching to pump them up. Smuggler's Copter provides card advantage and evasion, while Declaration in Stone helps deal with threats. Thalia, Heretic Cathar helps to slow down opponents, while Thalia's Lieutenant and Toolcraft Exemplar help to pump up the team. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures while maintaining a solid mana base for consistent plays.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Bomat Courier, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Insolent Neonate to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Key to the City helps to provide card advantage and enable easy discarding for madness cards like Fiery Temper and Alms of the Vein. Smuggler's Copter offers additional aggression and card filtering, while Unlicensed Disintegration provides removal. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent casting of spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and relentless attacks.

The deck focuses on using Aetherworks Marvel to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End into play. It also utilizes energy-generating cards like Woodweaver's Puzzleknot and Servant of the Conduit to fuel the Marvel's ability. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional energy and removal, while Traverse the Ulvenwald helps find key pieces of the combo. Kozilek's Return provides a board wipe effect, while Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Tireless Tracker offer additional value. Overall, the deck aims to ramp into a game-winning Emrakul while controlling the board with removal and value creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing Aetherworks Marvel to quickly ramp up energy counters in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes other energy generating cards like Whirler Virtuoso and Servant of the Conduit, as well as cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance for additional support. By efficiently managing energy resources and utilizing key combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and synergistic plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing energy-generating cards and Aetherworks Marvel to ramp up and summon powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker quickly. The combo aspect comes from the synergy between Aetherworks Marvel and high-cost creatures, enabling players to bring out game-changing threats early in the game. Tireless Tracker and Ishkanah, Grafwidow provide additional value and defense while Chandra, Torch of Defiance offers versatility and extra mana. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive plays and high-impact creatures.

This deck focuses on countering and removing your opponent's threats while generating card advantage. By using a combination of counterspells like Negate and Void Shatter, removal spells like Spatial Contortion and Harnessed Lightning, and card draw like Glimmer of Genius and Anticipate, the deck aims to control the pace of the game. The late game finishers Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Torrential Gearhulk provide a strong win condition. The mana base includes color fixing lands like Aether Hub and Wandering Fumarole to ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells in order to maintain control of the board and pressure the opponent. Using cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, Archangel Avacyn, and Selfless Spirit, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while protecting its own creatures. Adding in disruptive spells like Spell Queller, Reflector Mage, and Stasis Snare allows the deck to deal with threats from the opponent and maintain tempo. The deck's mana base allows for consistency in casting its spells and deploying its threats efficiently.
